member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of the HTTP status codes.
member.remarks: The HttpStatusCode enumeration contains the values of the HTTP status codes defined in RFC 2616 for HTTP 1.1.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 100. Indicates that the client should continue with its request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 101. Indicates that the server is switching the HTTP version or protocol on the connection.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 200. Indicates that the client's request has succeeded.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 201. Indicates that the client's request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 202. Indicates that the client's request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 203. Indicates that the returned metainformation is from a local or a third-party copy instead of the origin server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 204. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request but does not need to return an entity-body.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 205. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request and the user agent should reset the document view which caused the request to be sent.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 206. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource.

summary.para: Equivalent to status code 300. Indicates that the requested resource corresponds to any one of multiple representations.
MultipleChoices is a synonym for Ambiguous.
Equivalent to status code 300. Indicates that the requested resource corresponds to any one of multiple representations.
Ambiguous is a synonym for MultipleChoices.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
MovedPermanently is a synonym for Moved.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
Moved is a synonym for MovedPermanently.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Found is a synonym for Redirect.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Redirect is a synonym for Found.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
SeeOther is a synonym for RedirectMethod.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
RedirectMethod is a synonym for SeeOther.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 304. Indicates that the client has performed a conditional GET request and access is allowed, but the document has not been modified.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 305. Indicates that the requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 306. This code was used in a previous version of the specification, is no longer used, and is reserved for future use.

summary.para: Equivalent to status code 307. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
TemporaryRedirect is a synonym for RedirectKeepVerb.
Equivalent to status code 307. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
RedirectKeepVerb is a synonym for TemporaryRedirect.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 400. Indicates that the client's request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 401. Indicates that the client's request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 402. This code is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 403. Indicates that the server understood the client's request but is refusing to fulfill it.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 404. Indicates that the server has not found anything matching the request URI.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 405. Indicates that the method specified in the request line is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 406. Indicates that the server does not have the appropriate resource to respond to the accept headers in the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 407. Indicates that the client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 408. Indicates that the client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 409. Indicates that the client's request could not be completed due to a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 410. Indicates that the requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 411. Indicates that the server refuses to accept the client's request without a defined Content-Length.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 412. Indicates that the precondition given in one or more of the request header fields evaluated to false when it was tested on the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 413. Indicates that the client's request entity is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 414. Indicates that the request URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 415. Indicates that the entity of the client's request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 416. Indicates that none of the range specifier values in a Range request header field overlap the current extent of the selected resource.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 417. Indicates that the expectation given in an Expect request header field could not be met by the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 500. Indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 501. Indicates that the server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 502. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 503. Indicates that the server is currently unable to handle the client's request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 504. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server did not receive a timely response from the upstream server or some other auxiliary server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 505. Indicates that the server does not support the HTTP version used in the client's request.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of the status codes for the WebSocket connection closure.

remarks.para: The CloseStatusCode enumeration contains the values of the status codes for the WebSocket connection closure defined in RFC 6455 for the WebSocket protocol.

"Reserved value" must not be set as a status code in a close control frame by an endpoint. It's designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that the connection was closed due to a system grounds.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.NORMAL
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1000. Indicates a normal closure.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.AWAY
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1001. Indicates that an endpoint is "going away".

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.PROTOCOL_ERROR
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1002. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.INCORRECT_DATA
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1003. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.UNDEFINED
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1004. Still undefined. Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.NO_STATUS_CODE
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1005. Indicates that no status code was actually present. Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ABNORMAL
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1006. Indicates that the connection was closed abnormally. Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.INCONSISTENT_DATA
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1007. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received the data within a message that wasn't consistent with the type of the message.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.POLICY_VIOLATION
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1008. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TOO_BIG
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1009. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big to process.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.IGNORE_EXTENSION
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1010. Indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.SERVER_ERROR
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1011. Indicates that the server is terminating the connection because it has encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TLS_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1015. Indicates that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake. Reserved value.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Opcode
member.summary: Contains the values of the opcodes that denotes the frame type of the WebSocket frame.
member.remarks: The Opcode enumeration contains the values of the opcodes defined in RFC 6455 for the WebSocket protocol.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.CONT
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates a continuation frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.TEXT
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates a text frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.BINARY
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 2. Indicates a binary frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.CLOSE
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 8. Indicates a connection close frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.PING
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 9. Indicates a ping frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.PONG
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 10. Indicates a pong frame.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Logger
member.summary: Provides the simple logging functions.

remarks.para: The Logger class provides some methods that output the logs associated with the each values. If the value associated with a log is less than the , the log can not be outputted.
The default output action used by the output methods outputs the log data to the standard output stream and writes the same log data to the if it has a valid path.
If you want to run custom output action, you can replace the current output action with your output action by using the method.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.OPEN
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates that the connection is established and the communication is possible.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.CLOSING
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 2. Indicates that the connection is going through the closing handshake, or the WebSocket.Close method has been invoked.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.CLOSED
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 3. Indicates that the connection has been closed or could not be opened.
